result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order on Competency.  The defendant shall be released from Custody.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John W Smart in court with attorney Daniel P. Murray.   

Atty. Murray presented statements to the court.

Court continues the finding that the defendant is incompetent and not likely to regain competency.
Therefore, Court dismisses this matter and the defendant is discharged.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Order on Competency (not Competent).
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 11/05/14.

Order for Release (to Mr. David Diehs ONLY).
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 11/05/14.

Order for Referral to Corporation Counsel for Review.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 11/05/14.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John W Smart in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.   
Jessica Ott (defendant's guardian - from Easter Seals) appeared in court.

Atty. Bugenhagen requests that the guardian be allowed to have a copy of Dr. Manos and Dr. Pankwiezc evaluations.
Court Grants - Guardian allowed to have a copy of the evaluation.

All parties have received copies of the second competency evaluation by Dr. Manos.
Dr. Manos finds the defendant incompetent and not likely to regain competency.
Defense is in agreement to Dr. Manos evaluation.
State is also in agreement with Dr. Manos evaluation.

Court accepts both competency evaluations.
Court finds the defendant is not competency, and is not likely to regain competency during any statutory period of commitment.
Court suspends this matter and referred to Waukesha County Corporation Counsel for a Civil Committment (Chapter 51).
Court orders Waukesha County Jail to Release the Defendant to Dave Diehs ONLY specifically to be transported to Just Like Home 4 Facility.
Confines of the Jail are extended to include Just Like Home 4 Facility (W5140 County Road A, Elkhorn, WI).
Court will also allow release of both competency evaluations to the Just Like Home 4 Facility to be provided by Easter Seals.
Matter to be reviewed every 12 months.
Clerk's Office to do a separate order regarding the Defendant's release and referral to corporation counsel.
Affidavit of Services for Court appointed examiner and billing statement, received and filed, by Dr. Manos.
filed by Dr. Manos.

for competency exam. (second evaluation)
Dr. Manos to complete the exam.
